Got a Question

The English Language Preparation Programme is a full-time English course. Students can enter in  September (for 2 semesters) or in January (for 1 semester) depending on their language level.  It is designed for students with a good educational background who need to develop their English language skills and academic study skills in English before they begin their degree courses.
The programme consists of three separate courses:
What is the purpose of the course?
The English Language Preparation Programme (ELPP) is for students who want to study for a degree at the University of Abertay Dundee
column2: or any other British university. The Programme offers intensive training in English language and in academic study skills
column3: including the language you need for your degree subject.

column1: The Programme includes preparation for the IELTS test
column2: which students take in May. Study skills and subject preparation are assessed continuously and by examination.

column1: Students who complete the programme successfully are awarded a University of Abertay Dundee Certificate of Pre-MBA English Language Studies
column2: Certificate of Pre-MSc English Language Studies or Certificate of English Preparation Studies (for Foundation students) and are guaranteed a place on a degree course of study in the following September.

Hello I am Jamie and Iâm from Hong Kong.

Abertay University certainly has a lot to say. I'd like to tell you about our language program. It's not only an English language programme but a programme designed for students undertaking one of Abertay's courses later. So it's much better than a language course or an IELTS preparation course. It's not strictly just a language course â cultural
column3: academic and scientific topics are also covered in this one year programme.

column1: Personally I think it's really worthwhile for those who worry about their language skills and cultural shock.
This programme helped me improve my IELTS score enormously in the year.
The University accepts the following minimum qualifications from international students applying for full-time English language courses. In some circumstances
column2: students may be accepted without formal qualifications.

column1: English Language Preparation Programme - 2 semesters (September entry)
IELTS (The British Council's International English Language Testing Services)
TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language)
English Language Preparation Programme - 1 semester (January entry)
IELTS (The British Council's International English Language Testing Services)
TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language)
Formal English language qualifications (see below) are preferred but students may be accepted without them.

column2: internet based 60 and paper based test 497.
the focus is on general language improvement
column3: introduction to study skills and to the language of your chosen subject. You will also learn about living in the UK.

column2: you will have the opportunity to follow a module in your subject and familiarise yourself with how your subject is taught in English. You will also learn advanced study skills and prepare for the IELTS test.

column1: Throughout the year there are trips and social events.
ELPP students also have access to the University Library and computer and study facilities
column2: as well as the new Student Centre.

column1: You can apply for the Foundation
column3: and for a degree programme at the University of Abertay Dundee by completing the Direct Overseas Application Form.

column1: Read what our students have said about the ELPP:

column2: I felt I had improved my English skills and confidence. Communicating with other overseas students in class helped me to understand groupstudy methods. Reading textbooks and listening to formal lectures always comes up as a difficulty for a foreign student
column3: but I can handle these well now. I feel I was lucky to have this one year of study. I think it's no problem for me to engage in intensive postgraduate study in September."
